page.title: 02The Canal Basin.ELLESMERE
page.content: The Ellesmere canal is an interesting place.There's an old warehouse which is used for storing things.When it was first built there were arches in the wall leading out to the canal,but these arches are bricked up.There are two doors half way up the building which were used to load goods onto the canal boats.There is also a winch above the top door.The windows are louvred to stop the sun and the dirt getting in. Behind the warehouse is a derelict cottage and stable.The stables were used to house the horses which pulled the boats.The hay rack and water trough still remain there.It was also used by a blacksmith. An old crane still stands by the canal basin as a monuement to how the canal was many years ago.Two years ago the canal basin was tidied up.
